free_txt: Preliminary data.
BP
BP: Added preliminary data reference and
updated authors.
A comparison ionization chamber in which
known amounts of Pu239, enriched U235 and enriched
U238 could Be placed was inserted in the paraffin
block in the same position that the Pu239 or U235
sample had occupied. From the relative counts
recorded and the known cross sections one can
calculate that there are only 48 percent as many
delayed neutrons per fission from Pu239 as there are
from U235.
If one assumes the neutrons are all thermalized and
applies a correction, the percentage of delayed
neutrons from Pu239 relative to U235 is changed to 44
percent.  It is difficult to draw any conclusions
about the delayed neutrons of U238 from the data.
Boron trifluoride ionization chamber.
Due to imperfect thermalization of neutrons
authors can only say that the proper ratio lies within
the range of 44-48%, and is probably about 46%.
The number of delayed neutrons from Pu239
relative to the number from U235 has been measured by
means of a boron trifluoride ionization chamber
immersed in a block of paraffin. The sample of Pu239
was placed on one end of the bfs chamber and the
paraffin block was exposed to the direct beam of
neutrons from the cyclotron target about 10 ft away.
The strong neutron intensity, with the cyclotron on,
caused the grid of the first amplifier tube to drift
to such a negative voltage that nothing was recorded.
However, as soon as the cyclotron was turned off the
grid voltage would snap back to a sensitive bias
within a few milliseconds and the amplifier system
would then record boron disintegrations due to
delayed neutrons. The procedure, then, was to expose
the block to the cyclotron beam for 5 minutes and
then to count for 5 minutes with the beam off. This
was sufficient time for the delays to build up to
equilibrium during exposure and to die out completely
during the recording period. A sample of enriched
U235 prepared in as nearly as possible the same
geometry as the Pu239 was then substituted for the
Pu239 and the procedure was repeated. To determine
the contribution of the U238 in the sample, a disk of
uranium metal was substituted for the U235 sample,
and counts recorded. No sample at all gave no counts
at all.
Prompt neutrons.
235U enriched sample, no details on 239Pu sample.
page 560 of Phys.Rev.71(1947)560
